819986.name: Lustful Audacity

819990.desc: Boosts Atk, Def, Rec, and max HP by 10%

dictionary.lore: A glowing red crystal stone that contains the essence of Burny's fiery core. It feels hot and glows exceptionally bright where it is touched. Whoever holds it can still hear Burny's raging gnarls echoing in the distance “S..Stop blaming me for down time..!!”. The anger-filled stone strengthens its bearer with a bit of a temper.

819990.name: Burny's Soul Stone

819991.desc: Immensely strengthens the bearer, granting god-like abilities.

dictionary.lore: In the distant past, lost in the history of Grand Gaia.. The creator's of space and time forged a sword out of nothingness. A sword that is nothing, but powerful as a something. Its blades cut through space, slashes through time, a tool for exterminating their own faulty creations.

819991.name: Creator's Blade

819992.desc: Boosts Atk and Def by 20% & absorbs HP from normal attacks

dictionary.lore: A legendary aegis used by an ancient king centuries before the great war broke out. Few records of said king survived the trials of time, thus little is known about him, but it is said that he wore this aegis even in his sleep. He lived to be 326 years old. Some believe that the aegis held the power of immortality, and that he only died because the aegis was taken from him, though there hasn't been concrete evidence to prove this.

819992.name: Royal Aegis

819993.desc: Boosts Atk and Def by 15% & absorbs HP from normal attacks

dictionary.lore: A gleaming aegis found deep in a cave up in the mountains. No one knew who it belonged to, or why was it left in a cave, but its discovery stirred up quite a buzz among Summoners as its appearance greatly resembled the Royal Aegis. It is believed that it was made by the same person who created the legendary aegis.

819993.name: Silver Aegis

819994.desc: Adds possible Injury effect and absorbs HP from normal attacks

dictionary.lore: A crimson scythe said to have been forged by a craftsman who was well-versed in the dark arts. It's rumored that he infused the blood of a demon into the scythe when he crafted it. Viewed as an ominous object, it was sealed away after its creator passed on, but when the gods trampled across Grand Gaia, it mysteriously appeared again as if it was thirsty for a fight.

819994.name: Blood Scythe

819995.desc: Adds possible Injury effect and chance to absorb HP from normal attacks

dictionary.lore: Rumor has it that one night during a lunar eclipse, when the lands were engulfed in a cloak of darkness, a fanged beast with red glowing eyes, skeletal claws and huge leathery wings mysteriously appeared and extinguished an entire village. By the time rescue troops rushed to the village, all that was left was a broken fang the length of an adult's forearm. An exorcist used the fang to create a barrier to ward off beasts from disturbing the graves of the villagers.

819995.name: Fiend Fang

819996.desc: Boosts Atk by 10%, Def by 20% and Rec by 30%

dictionary.lore: Archives of the La Veda Republic wrote of a priestess who healed the weak and lifted the spirits of the masses with a unique healing magic that she imbued into her calming voice. Whenever she sang, the entire town seemed to be enveloped in a magical aura. This jewel was from a pendant she used to wear. It is said that its wearer can hear her singing, like a soft whisper, when they are physically or spiritually weak.

819996.name: Song Jewel

819997.desc: Boosts Atk by 5%, Def by 10% and Rec by 15%

dictionary.lore: This amulet is said to be the heirloom of a clan of warriors. For many generations it protected the descendants of the clan, bringing victory after victory. However, the overwhelming strength of the gods was too much for the clan and they were wiped out. The amulet was found among the ruins of war, and though the impact of battle had weakened its effects, it was still respected by warriors across the land, as it symbolized the clan's contributions during the war.

819997.name: Force Amulet

828011.desc: 35% boost to all parameters & greatly reduces BB gauge requirement and consumption

dictionary.lore: Enhanced to perfection by a mysterious sect of nomadic Artificers that arrived through a dimensional gateway during the Great War with the Gods, the Vestige Omega Series boasted impressive power-enhancing capabilities while greatly reducing the strain on the wielders' bodies. These special artifacts were personally graced with intricate energy weaves of the Grand Artificer himself and polished to emit a golden hue to represent their superiority. It is our greatest honor and privilege to award this treasure to you who have risen above the fiercest of challenges and earned your right to stand among the most legendary of Heroes.

828011.name: Vestige Omega

828012.desc: 30% boost to all parameters & reduces BB gauge requirement and consumption

dictionary.lore: Meticulously crafted by a mysterious sect of nomadic Artificers that arrived through a dimensional gateway during the Great War with the Gods, the Vestige Alpha Series boasted impressive power-enhancing capabilities while greatly reducing the strain on the wielders' bodies. Each artifact was engraved with the majestic Laurel Crown of Swords symbol and only commissioned to accomplished elite Heroes of the Human Army.

828012.name: Vestige Alpha

828013.desc: 100% boost to Atk, raises normal attack hits & boost to BB gauge during Spark

dictionary.lore: Enhanced to perfection by a mysterious sect of nomadic Artificers that arrived through a dimensional gateway during the Great War with the Gods, the Reign Omega series were imbued with the essence of a Greater Astral Beast, granting unparalleled offensive and energy leeching capabilities. These special artifacts were personally graced with intricate energy weaves of the Grand Artificer himself and polished to emit a golden hue to represent their superiority. It is our greatest honor and privilege to award this treasure to you who have risen above the fiercest of challenges and earned your right to stand among the most legendary of Heroes.

828013.name: Reign Omega

828014.desc: 50% boost to Atk, raises normal attack hits & probable boost to BB gauge during Spark

dictionary.lore: Meticulously crafted by a mysterious sect of nomadic Artificers that arrived through a dimensional gateway during the Great War with the Gods, the Reign Alpha Series were imbued with the essence of a Greater Astral Beast, granting unparalleled offensive and energy leeching capabilities. Each artifact was engraved with the majestic Laurel Crown of Swords symbol and only commissioned to accomplished elite Heroes of the Human Army.

828014.name: Reign Alpha

828017.desc: Probable 30% reduction of damage taken, negates defense ignore, critical and elemental based damage & 25% boost to Def, max HP

dictionary.lore: Enhanced to perfection by a mysterious sect of nomadic Artificers that arrived through a dimensional gateway during the Great War with the Gods, the Xenolith Omega series envelops the user with a force barrier, through a complex configuration of prisms, that absorbs and dampens the impact of devastating attacks. These special artifacts were personally graced with intricate energy weaves of the Grand Artificer himself and polished to emit a golden hue to represent their superiority. It is our greatest honor and privilege to award this treasure to you who have risen above the fiercest of challenges and earned your right to stand among the most legendary of Heroes.

828017.name: Xenolith Omega

828018.desc: Probable 25% reduction of damage taken, negates defense ignore damage & 20% boost to Def, max HP

dictionary.lore: Meticulously crafted by a mysterious sect of nomadic Artificers that arrived through a dimensional gateway during the Great War with the Gods, the Xenolith Alpha series envelops the user with a force barrier, through a complex configuration of prisms, that absorbs and dampens the impact of devastating attacks. Each artifact was engraved with the majestic Laurel Crown of Swords symbol and only commissioned to accomplished elite Heroes of the Human Army.

828018.name: Xenolith Alpha

829901.desc: Boosts max HP and Def by 5% & boosts Atk for Water types by 20%

dictionary.lore: A translucent blue blade infused with an Water soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith. It empowers the wielder who too possesses the soul of Water.

829901.name: Water Blade

829902.desc: Boosts max HP and Def by 10% & boosts Atk for Water types by 35%

dictionary.lore: A translucent blue blade infused with a vicious Water soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith. It empowers the wielder who too possesses the soul of Water.

829902.name: Tidal Blade

838001.desc: 10% boost to all parameters & greatly restores HP each turn

dictionary.lore: An ordinary looking fur cloak worn by Randolph. After a transformation, the cloak expands into a shroud of dark red mist that grants the wearer rapid regeneration of flesh wounds. It is uncertain where Randolph obtained the cloak, as he was not known to wear such a garment during his service as a Witch Hunter.

838001.name: Wolven Shroud

838002.desc: 10% boost to all parameters & 70% boost to Spark damage

dictionary.lore: An elegant plume from the extremely rare white raven, and a gift that Randolph presented to Ravenna on her 20th birthday. After a transformation, the plume transforms into a visor that enhances the wearer's visual and cognitive prowess. Ravenna has always called it her lucky plume.

838002.name: Raven Plume

838003.desc: Increases resistance to all status ailments, probable slight HP recovery when damaged & reduces damage taken from Dark elements by 5%

dictionary.lore: Sprigs of young clover - preserved by powerful blessings and arranged meticulously into a majestic wreath. Rumors held that those fortunate enough to discover and possess these had been blessed with protection against wounds, ailments and evil.

838003.name: Shamrock Circlet

839901.desc: Boosts max HP and Def by 5% & boosts Atk for Earth types by 20%

dictionary.lore: An emerald green blade infused with an Earth soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith. It empowers the wielder who too possesses the soul of Earth.

839901.name: Earth Blade

839902.desc: Boosts max HP and Def by 10% & boosts Atk for Earth types by 35%

dictionary.lore: An emerald green blade infused with a vicious Earth soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith. It empowers the wielder who too possesses the soul of Earth.

839902.name: Terra Blade

849901.desc: Boosts max HP and Def by 5% & boosts Atk for Thunder types by 20%

dictionary.lore: A blade infused with a Thunder soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith.  It empowers the wielder who too possesses the soul of Thunder.

849901.name: Electric Blade

849902.desc: Boosts max HP and Def by 10% & boosts Atk for Thunder types by 35%

dictionary.lore: A crackling electric blade infused with a vicious Thunder soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith. It greatly empowers the wielder who too possesses the soul of Thunder.

849902.name: Lightning Blade

dictionary.lore: A shield infused with a Thunder soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith.  Due to its elemental nature, the shield absorbs and negates Thunder based attacks, protecting the bearer from much damage.

A crackling electric shield infused with a vicious Thunder soul, forged by a powerful elemental blacksmith. Its elemental nature absorbs and diffuses Thunder based attacks greatly, protecting the bearer from much damage.
A shield infused with an Earth soul, forged by an elemental blacksmith. Its elemental nature diffuses Earth based attacks, protecting the bearer from much damage.
A jade green shield infused with a vicious Earth shield, forged by an elemental blacksmith. Its elemental nature diffuses Earth based attacks greatly, protecting the bearer from much damage.

849990.desc: Boosts Rec by 10%, and Increased Critical Chance

dictionary.lore: A glowing yellow crystal stone charged with electrical energy that gently jolts the bearer, accelerating recovery rate of the body. It's electrical energy is rumored to stimulate the bearer to be more alert in battle.

849990.name: Charge Stone

858930.desc: Greatly boosts Zel, Karma & Item drop rate

dictionary.lore:
A beautiful crystal egg, a highly uncommon variant of the mystical eggs Egg Hunter Carrol collects.
Apart from looking like an overglorified paperweight, it doesn't seem to do a thing...
Oh, what luck! A pouch of Zel on the ground! Finders keepers!

858930.name: Crystalline Egg

880001.desc: A mysterious relic used to evolve the Unit Grandt
880001.name: Ruby Relic

880003.desc: A mysterious relic used to evolve the Unit Elaina
880003.name: Emerald Relic

880011.desc: A mysterious relic used to transcend the Unit Mercenary Grandt
880011.name: Sanguine Relic

880013.desc: A mysterious relic used to transcend the Unit Mercenary Mage Elaina
880013.name: Verdant Relic

880020.desc: A shiny medal for those who have stood the test of time.

dictionary.lore: A shiny medal made to adorn the chest of those who have stood the test of time. Many claim it holds precious memories.

880020.name: Toy Medal

dictionary.lore: A metal fragment of Forgebreaker

880101.desc: A small crystal belonging to Zenia

dictionary.lore: A small crystal belonging to Zenia

880101.name: Obsidian Quartz

880102.desc: A mysterious stone that comes from within the Void

dictionary.lore: A mysterious stone that comes from within the Void

880102.name: Void Chunk

880111.desc: A small gem used to forge Ultor's blades

dictionary.lore: A gem infused with the distilled essence of a Cyclaw. Rage of a hundred suns sealed within

880111.name: Cyclaw's Rage

880112.desc: A small gem used to forge Tridon's trident

dictionary.lore: A gem infused with the distilled essence of a Hydraloid. Unrelenting wrath ensures the destruction of foes

880112.name: Hydraloid's Wrath

880113.desc: A small gem used to forge Andaria’s bow

dictionary.lore: A gem infused with the distilled essence of an Euryalis. Nimble and grace to hit all targets

880113.name: Euryalis’ Grace

880114.desc: A small gem used to forge Zedus’ spear

dictionary.lore: A gem infused with the distilled essence of a Grievesnare. Indomitable will that can move mountains

880114.name: Grievesnare’s Will

880115.desc: A small gem used to forge Aurelia’s harp

dictionary.lore: A gem infused with the distilled essence of a Stormwing. Soothing charm to lull enemies to a restive state

880115.name: Stormwing’s Charm

880116.desc: A small gem used to forge Hadaron's Axe

dictionary.lore: A gem infused with the distilled essence of a Netherhound. Deception and treachery abound

880116.name: Netherhound’s Deceit

880201.desc: A precious metal used to craft the Deva’s weapons and armor, as well as their grandest buildings.

dictionary.lore: When refined the right way, the metal weighs incredibly light and is impenetrable to most materials except itself and the Morokai’s infamous Orihalcum

880201.name: Mithril

880202.desc: Found in the deepest underground caverns, Morokai harvest this special ore for their best equipment.

dictionary.lore: Extremely dense and almost impossible to break, weaponry and armor made from Orihalcum are incredibly heavy but are nigh impervious to all manner of attacks

880202.name: Orihalcum

880211.desc: A unique ore used to improve Korzan’s axe.

dictionary.lore: The aspect of the Destroyer’s rage made manifest. One can feel the unrestraint anger gushing out from it. The peace one seeks is found within

880211.name: Fury of the Destroyer

880212.desc: A unique ore used to improve Haile’s battlestaff.

dictionary.lore: The aspect of the Ice Queen’s pride made manifest. One can feel the utter disdain seeping into the surroundings. Pride goes before destruction, a haughty Deva before a fall

880212.name: Scorn of the Ice Queen

880213.desc: The aspect of the Monster Hunter's bond made manifest.

dictionary.lore: The aspect of the Monster Hunter's bond made manifest. One can feel the familial bond of the clan growing within. Loyalty above all.

880213.name: Bond of the Monster Hunter

880214.desc: The aspect of the Paladin's grief made manifest.

dictionary.lore: The aspect of the Paladin's grief made manifest. One can feel the silent anguish engulf the area. To weep is to make less the depth of grief.

880214.name: Grief of the Storm Champion

880215.desc: The aspect of the Loremaster's love made manifest.

dictionary.lore: The aspect of the Loremaster's love made manifest. Once can feel the compulsion to understand all. Love has no boundaries.

880215.name: Love of the Loremaster

880216.desc: The aspect of the Shadow Cat's desire made manifest.

dictionary.lore: The aspect of the Shadow Cat's desire made manifest. One can feel the deep yearning to belong. Home is where the heart is.

880216.name: Desire of the Shadow Cat

dictionary.lore: A pungent chocolate said to be only given to the pure-hearted young of Randall by the guardians in the skies. It is a rare and precious Item that should be cherished.

880218.desc: A beautiful flower that shines in seven different colors

dictionary.lore: A mysterious rainbow colored flower found deep in the forest where Bonnie headed. Rumors say the essence of this flower supplies the luminous energy for Bonnie's cannon.

880218.name: Chromatic Blossom

880219.desc: A fleshy tail from a massive serpent that is wet to the touch.

dictionary.lore: Acquired from the Ulnhann's serpents and carefully preserved with nutri-liquid, these tails are then processed for their curative properties. They are known to accelerate tissue and bone growth, turning months of healing into mere days.

880219.name: Viper Tail

880220.desc: An inflexible scale from a mature wyrm that makes a soft clinking sound.

dictionary.lore: These scales are obtained by Vharag riders once their mounts begin to shed their skin. Flexible and easy to shape at first, they quickly harden as they dry into their new form. After some additional treatment, the scales become harder than steel, and equally as sharp.

880220.name: Molted Wyrmscale

880221.desc: A blue flower that glows softly under the right conditions.

dictionary.lore: These freshly-picked blooms are prized by the Greherd for their hallucinogenic properties, especially during their first glow. Grown in their greenhouses together with other poisonous plants, they are often dried and added to battle stimulants to enhance their effects. They tend to cause dehydration, irregular bowel movements, and severe muscle spasms if improperly used.

880221.name: Sarayagaza Bloom

880222.desc: A skull of a small animal reinforced with scraps of metal.

dictionary.lore: A primitive bludgeon made from a monster's dried thighbone. It is the first weapon a Khree warrior learns to master from childhood. Once it has been bathed in the blood of sufficient victims, it is typically ground to a fine powder and used as an ingredient in battle curatives.

880222.name: Bone Club

880223.desc: An eerie glowing bone. Unique event crafting material.

dictionary.lore: These eerie bones are said to have a strange and dark power within them. Items crafted from these bones give great power to those able to wield them.

880223.name: Eerie Bone

880224.desc: A sticky piece of the shambler plant, freshly cut.

dictionary.lore: Obtained from live shamblers, these vines are quickly preserved in nutri-liquid to ensure that they stay fresh. Highly prized for their ability to adhere to any surface and act as an improvised pump, shambler cuttings are prized in Vardket bio-mechanical constructs, especially for building circulation and muscle systems.

880224.name: Shambler Cuttings

880225.desc: A tough, barbed stinger from phrun shuttlebugs.

dictionary.lore: Unlike most organic material obtained by the forces of the Vardket, phrun stingers only require that one lay small pieces of raw meat near shuttlebug nests to harvest a sizeable number for various uses. The stingers are then pulled out and cleaned before being used for a variety of items, such as arrowheads and climbing gear.

880225.name: Phrun Stingers

880226.desc: A piece of wood obtained from the burbur tree.

dictionary.lore: Harvested from burbur trees by highly trained (and heavily armored) professionals, these pieces of wood are dried over the course of several days to reduce the potency of their man-killing sap to a slightly more tolerable form. Accidental ingestion of the final product tends to result in a longand painful demise, hencethe common tactic to load its powdered form in artillery shells.

880226.name: Burbur Branch

880227.desc: A pair of fangs extracted from the centipedes found near burbur trees.

dictionary.lore: Taken from the centipedes that are found around burbur trees, these steel-hard fangs are useful in ensuring that sorcerous armaments never lose their potency with time. While harvesting them does take a significant amount of effort and risk (plus a torn limb here and there), some feel that the benefits greatly outweigh the costs.

880227.name: Centipede Fang

880235.desc: A soft tail taken from the dhlerp, tough and sinewy.

dictionary.lore: A soft tail taken from the dhlerp, tough and sinewy. It can be used to reinforce muscles and joints with the right materials.

880235.name: Dhlerp Tail

880236.desc: Sand infused with the essence of time, it glitters in odd circumstances.

dictionary.lore: Sand infused with the essence of time, it glitters in odd circumstances. Specialized equipment is necessary to handle it in order to avoid contamination incidents.

880236.name: Chronal Sand

880237.desc: An organic crystal grown from special farms deep underwater.

dictionary.lore: An organic crystal grown from special farms deep underwater that is used as a cheap battery for flesh-implanted enchantments.

880237.name: Sea-star Crystal

880238.desc: Chains forged from volcanic lava that resist and dispel any magic.

dictionary.lore: Chains forged from volcanic lava that resist and dispel any magic. When used incorrectly, however, they can sever a soul from a body.

880238.name: Cthnos Chain

880239.desc: A glowing rock found in the frozen wastes of northern Orebus.

dictionary.lore: A glowing rock found in the frozen wastes of northern Orebus. It contains a small amount of magic and its dust is highly abrasive.

880239.name: Whiteland Rock

880240.desc: Herbs specially grown by the Greherd to hold magical energy.

dictionary.lore: Herbs specially grown by the Greherd to hold magical energy. These can be toxic if improperly prepared and consumed.

880240.name: Infused Herbs

880241.desc: A vial containing a specially cultured magical ailment crafted by the Greherd.

dictionary.lore: A vial containing a specially cultured magical ailment crafted by the Greherd. It is a key component in their weapons development.

880241.name: Aqueous Plague

880242.desc: A fossil of creatures long extinct. No one knows what they were.

dictionary.lore: A fossil of creatures long extinct. No one knows what they were, but their bodies are believed to have held minute traces of magic.

880242.name: Old Fossil

880243.desc: Glittering like a jewel in the night, this gem contains a small amount of magical power.
880243.name: Distilled Ether

880244.desc: Found in the heart of lands untouched yet by man, this magical creature--held in amber--is a potent source of power.
880244.name: Amber Butterfly

890001.desc: Crystallized embers shed from a Revenant's shell. Commonly used as a catalyst in crafting.

dictionary.lore: Crystallized embers shed from the outer shell of a Revenant. Its lingering heat makes it perpetually warm to the touch. Often used as a catalyst in crafting. Shattering the crystal causes a burst of fire to erupt from the cracks. While not particularly deadly on its own, it can easily spark off an explosion during experimentation. Handle with care.

890001.name: Orebi Emberstone

890002.desc: Crystallized flakes shed from a Revenant's shell. Commonly used as a catalyst in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
Crystallized ice flakes shed from the outer shell of a Revenant. Its frigid surface makes it hard to handle without gloves. Often used as a catalyst in crafting.

Since it melts at a much slower pace than regular ice, some researchers use it as a substitute to keep samples cold. As of now, there doesn't seem to be any negative side effects...yet.

890002.name: Orebi Cryostone

890003.desc: Crystallized wind shed from a Revenant's shell. Commonly used as a catalyst in crafting.

dictionary.lore: Crystallized wind shed from the outer shell of a Revenant. It boggles the mind how air can be compressed into a solid form, but it is more accurately energy. Often used as a catalyst in crafting. Such a material is an odd side effect of Revenant energy, and a great curiosity to researchers. Breaking the crystal releases a harmless, gentle gust.

890003.name: Orebi Galestone

890004.desc: Crystallized sparks shed from a Revenant's shell. Commonly used as a catalyst in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
Crystallized sparks shed from the outer shell of a Revenant. Gives off a powerful static shock when brought within close range of several other crystals. Often used as a catalyst in crafting.

These crystals are among the more dangerous of the Revenant materials, as their volatility and penchant for loosing sparks can set off a string of terrible accidents.

890004.name: Orebi Sparkstone

890005.desc: Extremely polished crystal shed from a Revenant's shell. Commonly used as a catalyst in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
An extremely polished crystal shed from the outer shell of a Revenant. Its incredible shine can cause it to be mistaken as a precious mineral. Often used as a catalyst in crafting.

Though these crystals seem like choice materials for jewelry, they actually contain a powerful burst of light that can cause momentary blindness. Don't drop it!

890005.name: Orebi Gleamstone

890006.desc: Unnaturally pulsing crystal shed from a Revenant's shell. Commonly used as a catalyst in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
An unnaturally pulsing crystal shed from the outer shell of a Revenant. Its dark surface brims with an eerie energy. Often used as a catalyst in crafting.

These crystals react most powerfully to other phantom energies on Orebus. Some researchers report hearing whispers upon pressing an ear to the crystal, but others claim to hear them entirely within their mind.

890006.name: Orebi Gloomstone

890007.desc: A large crystal of blazing energy left by a Fire Revenant. A valuable material used in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
A large crystal occasionally left behind by a Fire Revenant. Much too hot to handle without safety precautions, but contains a substantial amount of energy that makes it a valuable material in crafting.

Research suggests that these crystals are formed when energy solidifies within the core of a Revenant. The raging flames of a Fire Revenant dance within its glossy surface, as if it had captured a sliver of fiery hell within its spherical form.

890007.name: Inferno Omphalos

890008.desc: A large crystal of frost energy left by an Ice Revenant. A valuable material used in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
A large crystal occasionally left behind by an Ice Revenant. So cold that it causes frostbite upon prolonged skin contact. Contains a substantial amount of energy that makes it a valuable material in crafting.

Research suggests that these crystals are formed when energy solidifies within the core of a Revenant. Its smooth surface is misted over from the ice within. Might this be the frozen heart of a Revenant, if they truly possess souls?

890008.name: Blizzard Omphalos

890009.desc: A large crystal of gale energy left by an Earth Revenant. A valuable material used in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
A large crystal occasionally left behind by an Earth Revenant. Surprisingly heavy one moment and lightweight the next. Contains a substantial amount of energy that makes it a valuable material in crafting.

Research suggests that these crystals are formed when energy solidifies within the core of a Revenant. Both land and earth essences swirl dizzyingly within its form. Mother Nature welcomes all creatures into her bosom, regardless of their origin.

890009.name: Gaia Omphalos

890010.desc: A large crystal of electric energy left by a Thunder Revenant. A valuable material used in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
A large crystal occasionally left behind by a Thunder Revenant. Electricity leaps across its golden surface, making it a significant hazard to lab equipment. Contains a substantial amount of energy that makes it a valuable material in crafting.

Research suggests that these crystals are formed when energy solidifies within the core of a Revenant. Crackling bolts of lightning coalesce in arcing streaks within it, bringing to mind powerful storms.

890010.name: Storm Omphalos

890011.desc: A large crystal of life energy left by a Light Revenant. A valuable material used in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
A large crystal occasionally left behind by a Light Revenant. Pale and gleaming, it gives off a dim light at all times, growing brighter as dawn approaches. Contains a substantial amount of energy that makes it a valuable material in crafting.

Research suggests that these crystals are formed when energy solidifies within the core of a Revenant. Light has always been associated with life, and it is little wonder its associated Revenant constantly seeks the embrace of the first sunrise.

890011.name: Dawn Omphalos

890012.desc: A large crystal of black energy left by a Dark Revenant. A valuable material used in crafting.

dictionary.lore:
A large crystal occasionally left behind by a Dark Revenant. Dark, yet mesmerising, it seems to grow brighter as dusk approaches. Contains a substantial amount of energy that makes it a valuable material in crafting.

Research suggests that these crystals are formed when energy solidifies within the core of a Revenant. Darkness has always been associated with death and fear, as it is in the war-torn plane of Orebus, but it is not taboo to some cultures. Death, after all, is but the next stage of life.

890012.name: Dusk Omphalos

890013.desc: A sharp scale from the time of the ancients in Orebus. This can be used as a crafting component.

dictionary.lore:
A long, sharp scale of unknown material, said to hail from the time of the ancients. This can be used as a component in crafting.

The researchers are divided on whether this scale is organic in origin or was deliberately crafted to look that way. Whatever it is, the beautiful patterns on its surface are mesmerizing to behold.

890013.name: Proto Scale

890014.desc: Rainbow fabric woven from Orebi spidersilk. Thin yet flexible, it is a popular crafting component.

dictionary.lore:
Rainbow-hued and light as a feather, the strange fabric known as "Cloudweave" is spun from the silk of indigenous spiders of Orebus. Though paper-thin, it is surprisingly flexible, making it a popular choice in crafting.

When harvested, the silk itself is translucent and colorless. Only when it is woven into fabric and exposed to light does it take on its signature gradient.

890014.name: Cloudweave

890015.desc: Fine, metallic ash from the sandwastes of Orebus. An interesting choice as a crafting component.

dictionary.lore:
Fine, metallic ash from the sand-blasted wastes of Orebus. Their unique composition makes it an interesting choice as a component in crafting.

Under certain conditions, these ashes are sometimes found to generate a weak electromagnetic field of their own. Superstitious researchers of the Orebus Special Inquiry claim these ashes to be the remains of those who once called Orebus home.

890015.name: Ashes of Orebus

890016.desc: Golden fire produced from Revenant essence that burns life force. A volatile and dangerous material.

dictionary.lore:
Flickering golden fire that is said to burn not flesh, but the very life force of anything it touches. A volatile and dangerous crafting material.
This phantom ember is produced when a Fire Revenant's flame is continuously fed with the shadowy essence of a Dark Revenant. According to Giselle, this might very well be the concentrated ire of countless Orebus souls lost to bloody conflict.

890016.name: Spectral Ire

890017.desc: Eerily beautiful alchemical flower grown from Revenant essence. Useful as a crafting material.

dictionary.lore:
An eerily beautiful flower created by harnessing Revenant essences to mimic natural life. Useful as a crafting material due to its alchemical nature.
Though grown from Earth and Water Revenant essences, these flowers live only as long as energy is supplied to them. Giselle argues that this is evidence that a Revenant possesses more than just the basic building blocks necessary to animate.

890017.name: Ghostbloom

890018.desc: Fragment supercharged with Revenant essence. Highly resilient with many crafting applications.

dictionary.lore:
Supercharged streaks of blue and white energy dance across this rock fragment. Highly resilient, this material has many applications in crafting.
A Thunder Revenant's essence is treated with energy pulses from a Light Revenant's essence, which if done correctly will supercharge a base fragment. Giselle attributes its lengthy process and low success rate to a "phantom energy" that is difficult to distill.

890018.name: Spark of Life

890019.desc: An orb containing the combined essence of all Revenants. Extremely rare material for crafting.

dictionary.lore:
The combined essences of all elemental Revenants, pulsing in a comforting, harmonious vibe, are concentrated within this palm-sized orb. Extremely rare and sought-after as a crafting material due to its wondrous properties.
The energy-rich debris of Orebus has infused abandoned Guardians with what Giselle believes are the deceased souls of Orebus inhabitants. As a result, the aptly named Revenants carry fragmented memories within their elemental bodies. Concentrating their essences into a single source results in a truly splendid sight.

890019.name: Soul Splendor

890020.desc: A plume of alien texture and gloss not found on Grand Gaia. Used to craft Karcosan accessories.

dictionary.lore:
At first glance, this seems like a reject from Giselle's "Saturnine" collection of Lead Feathers, but upon closer inspection reveals an alien texture and gloss atypical of any feather on Grand Gaia. A precious material said to be used as a component for Karcosan hair accessories.

As far as anyone can tell, Karcosa does not exist within Grand Gaia. Giselle has been on holiday to the strange land of Karcosa several times, and this is one of the keepsakes from her trips.

890020.name: Karcosan Plume

890021.desc: Dull silver feather laced with lead. Has limited application as a crafting material.

dictionary.lore:
This dull silver feather contains traces of lead, which might explain its oxymoronic name. Has limited application as a material for crafting, as it may result in indirect poisoning.

Giselle has a collection of these, which she proudly shows off in an album titled "Saturnine." Where she even procures these, though, is yet another of her well-kept mysteries.

890021.name: Lead Feather

890022.desc: A grapnel from a fiery beast found in the depths of volcanic mountains.

dictionary.lore: A grapnel from a fiery beast found in the depths of a volcanic mountain. This part is highly sought after due to the difficulty of retrieving an undamaged sample. The beast uses its claws in battle to attack invaders and are thus highly susceptible to breakage, rendering it useless.

890022.name: Hellfire Grapnel

890023.desc: Bones from a fiery beast that dwells in the volcanic mountains.

dictionary.lore: Bones from a fiery beast that dwells in the volcanic mountains. Stout and sturdy, it is extremely dense and heavy. Many hunters prefer to extract its more valuable claws, but those with less luck may instead scavenge for its bones. However, many are discarded along the way because they are far too heavy to be carried back.

890023.name: Hellfire Cartilage

890024.desc: A sedimentary stone formed from the tears of executed innocents.

dictionary.lore: A jewel of extraordinary composition left behind by the widow of a national hero. Betrayed by his ruthless king, the hero and his wife wept for his tragic fate before the execution. Their tears seeped into the ground around the execution block, pooling in a small crevice. Over time, the chiseled rock acquired a polished shine from the tears of other victims. It is said that only the tears of the truly innocent can harden into a jewel like this...

890024.name: Tears of Innocence

890025.desc: A small stone emitting a dark aura, formed from the tainted sins of evil-doers.

dictionary.lore: A small stone emitting a cold and dark aura disproportionate to its size. Once, there was a man who committed every sin imaginable to the average person. His soul was so tainted that upon his execution, he was not allowed into the afterlife. Rumor has it that his wraith haunts the execution grounds, feeding off the dark energies to spread his malignant influence.

890025.name: Grain of Sin

890033.desc: A confluence of souls, fossilized in ancient amber.

dictionary.lore: A confluence of souls, fossilized in ancient amber. Magical sensors near the stone are inundated with a multitude of voices and emotions. Calibrated sensors are able to identify Orebi accents and dialects among the psychic clamor.

890033.name: Whispering Shard

890034.desc: A trinket from a faraway land, said to bring good luck to its recipient. This one seems...off.

dictionary.lore:
A bundle of ashen feathers, petrified leaves, and twigs tied up with a golden cord. In some faraway lands, this trinket is said to bestow blessings upon the recipient, and is often received from a monk or priest in the temple.

The demand of this item is so high in some areas that the temples are unwilling to distribute more than they claim their gods can provide. In dark alleys and lonely street corners, though, the truly desperate might come across a handful of these for sale for a good amount of coin from foxish individuals.

890034.name: Replica Trinket

890035.desc: A cast-off scrap of material that feels cold to the touch. Slightly burned at the edges.

dictionary.lore:
Dull and slightly burned, this scrap of material feels cold to the touch. Peering closely, it seems to resemble the white robes of a warrior monk.
Its jagged edges suggest it was torn off in a hurry, perhaps in response to fire of some kind. It is notably missing the sort of smoky smell you'd expect it to have, though.

Tales of monks and priests from that faraway land speak of their unique ability to channel divine energy into a searing light, causing deceitful creatures of evil to burst into holy flame upon contact.

890035.name: Ruse Scrap

890036.desc: A small vial of clear liquid from the rivers of Di'yu. Something seems to shift inside…

dictionary.lore:
A small vial of clear liquid retrieved from the many rivers of Di'yu, the underworld of Aimyhr. Are those strange shadows shifting inside, or is it merely a trick of the light?

The rivers are said to carry along the lost memories of souls on their way to Di'yu, and silt deposits are especially sought after as a component in alchemy and magical studies. The emotional intensity of certain memories form glittering pearls among the finer grain.

890036.name: Memory Vial

890037.desc: A beautifully kept plume in rich royal blue, the emblem of a noble arcanist house of yore.

dictionary.lore:
With its rich, royal blue, plumes of this quality were often emblematic of particularly old and established noble arcanist houses. Variously used as quills, decoration, and accessories, most members of the family carried one on their person. To receive one through courier was, at best, a one-off threat—and at worst, a sign from the Mageslayer that their entire house was next.

Vrána's house was certainly prestigious enough to warrant these tokens of status, but the young heiress now sees them as a running tally of her targets.

890037.name: Royal Pinion

890038.desc: Sharp, pointed metal bit fashioned after a claw. Used by assassins as concealed caltrops.

dictionary.lore:
A sharp, pointed bit of lightweight metal fashioned after a crow's claw. Capable of filling a variety of functions, but most notably as concealed caltrops by savvy—and sassy—assassins. The crow, after all, is one of their most popular symbols.

Besides its more practical uses, Vrána prefers to hollow them at the base and fit them over her fingers. Useless in manipulating her enormous crossbow, but oh so fashionable.

890038.name: Crowsgrip

890039.desc: Preserved bone coated in luminous green paint. Supposedly used in ancient and forgotten rituals.

dictionary.lore:
A well-preserved bone coated in strangely luminous green paint. Laboratory analysis shows traces of toxic plant-based chemicals, which can only be derived from the jungles of a long-forgotten civilization.

Scattered remnants of their rituals still survive, most of which detail the painstaking process of ritual bone-painting. More horrifying, however, are the anecdotes where these bones are removed while the sacrifice is still alive to the cacophonous screams and frenzied chants of the audience.

890039.name: Ritual Bone

890040.desc: An ancient coin from a long-forgotten civilization. Features a skull motif atop a disc of bronze.

dictionary.lore:
An ancient coin from a civilization long forgotten in the mists of time. Despite its apparent age, the bronze disc still retains some of its luster, and the skull motif imprinted upon it remains untarnished.

Death and the celebration of death appears to have been an important part of that civilization, as evidenced by grave goods recovered from the few tombs discovered thus far. The overwhelming presence of gilded skulls suggests that particularly cherished spoils of war or sacrifice are taken into the afterlife.

890040.name: Grave Gold

890041.desc: A cracked ankh, with very little magic left in it.

dictionary.lore: A cracked ankh, with very little magic left in it. In a more prosperous time, when the people of Urzyma actively worshipped the gods, they were granted access to magical arts in return. Magical energies were stored in beautful handcrafted ankhs, which were carried around on persons.

890041.name: Shattered Faith

890042.desc: A dull blue scarab jewel, clouded and rough.

dictionary.lore: A dull blue scarab jewel, clouded and rough. These crests were once worn proudly by the Priests of Silence, glorying in their patron Osiris. When Osiris fell and his priests were scoured, the magic faded gradually from the jewels.

890042.name: Amulet of Renewal

890043.desc: A ruby carved in the shape of a teardrop.

dictionary.lore: A ruby carved in the shape of a teardrop. When the Hemet of Aesys learnt about the fall of Osiris, they shared in the solace of their goddess and carved ornate teardrop jewels from great rubies. In defiance of the God-King, the priestesses continued to carry out their seasonal rites in secret.

890043.name: Enveloping Grief

890044.desc: A handful of golden sand that somehow manages to glitter even in the dark.

dictionary.lore: A handful of golden sand, which was said to blanket all of Urzyma once upon a time. Over centuries, unimaginable amounts of gold was refined from the land and sold to lords from distant regions. Now, such rare grains are only known to be found within the God-King's treasury.

890044.name: Glittersand

890045.desc: A small pot of violet ink popularly said to be the true 'lifeforce' of the scribes.

dictionary.lore:
A small pot of violet ink popularly said to be the true 'lifeforce' of the scribes. It has a faintly aromatic scent that reminds one of the riverbank.

In the age of the gods, violet ink was worth its weight in gold, for it was said to contain the essence of the divine. Only scribes were allowed to use it, and even then, they could only inscribe heka, or hymns to the gods. Under the rule of certain kings, their funerary rites also made use of this ink, though it is unclear whether it was out of religious devotion or sheer hubris.

890045.name: Scribesblood

890046.desc: Remnants of spent arcane energy. Glows faintly in the dark and emits a tingling aura.

dictionary.lore:
Remnants of spent arcane energy. Glows faintly in the dark and emits a tingling aura. Grain-like and glittering, these are often mistaken for tiny crystals.

Practitioners of heka are familiar with these grains. When arcane energy manifests physically, it leaves an 'imprint' upon the fabric of the world, such as smoke trails or motes of light. Upon contact with an object, the energy usually scatters as a burst, leaving trace amounts of these grains. It is not uncommon for spell-slinging grounds to be littered with arcane remnants, giving their floors a distinctive blue tinge.

890046.name: Arcane Remnant

890047.desc: A peculiar ornament shaped like a cold, steely eye. Inlaid with fine metal and a small jewel.

dictionary.lore:
A peculiar ornament shaped like a cold, steely eye. Inlaid with fine metal and a small jewel.

Crafted with great care by a high priest or priestess, these ornaments are bestowed upon those who have walked faithfully by the side of Truth and worked all their life to uphold Justice. They are traditionally worn upon the forehead, symbolizing the third divine eye.

890047.name: Oculus of Truth

890048.desc: A small handful of blood-red earth. Said to originate from the domain of Set, the Deceiver.

dictionary.lore:
A small handful of blood-red earth. Said to originate from the domain of Set, the Deceiver.

In contrast with the fertile black soil where the first humans raised their civilizations, the red soil of the desert was dry, barren, and perpetually scorching. Some compare their vibrant colors to blood; the more superstitious (and dastardly) of Set's followers smear it as a ritual tattoo, believing it is in fact the ichor of the Deceiver.

890048.name: Blood Soil

890049.desc: A starburst of emerald dust that sparkles joyfully as it drifts through the air.

dictionary.lore: A starburst of emerald dust that sparkles joyfully as it drifts through the air. It leaves behind a trail of light that seems to shimmer in different colors depending on the angle.

890049.name: Starburst Dust

890050.desc: A solid bronze ingot, slightly weathered from storage. A commonly used material for metalworking.

dictionary.lore:
A solid bronze ingot, slightly weathered from storage. A commonly used material for metalworking.

In older civilizations, ore processing and refining produced ingots such as these. Shaped in a narrow brick, they could easily be stacked and loaded into crates. With the advent of metalworking and smithing, the shape and size of these materials made for a convenient way to create metal products.

890050.name: Bronze Ingot

890051.desc: A small piece of crackling wood for kindling. The fire within feels more radiant than normal.

dictionary.lore:
A small piece of crackling wood for kindling. The fire within feels more radiant than normal.

The tradition of keeping an "eternal flame" burning is central to many beliefs across the land. Though their methods, reasons, and ideologies may differ, most agree that kindling for a sacred flame is itself blessed by divine energies. Perhaps that is why this little bit of wood feels different.

890051.name: Holy Kindling

890052.desc: Revives one ally from KO status to 50% HP.

dictionary.lore:
A mushroom freshly picked from the mountainside. Has an earthy flavor that's delicious when grilled.
Some believe that this is a matsutake mushroom, dubbed "jewel of the mountain" for commanding high prices on the markets. Its penchant for growing in secluded paths makes it a difficult treasure to harvest.
For others, however, a mushroom is just a mushroom—that is, food.

890052.name: Mountain Jewel

890060.desc: A cloth scrap in a vibrant purple hue, emblematic of a powerful champion.

dictionary.lore: A cloth scrap in a vibrant purple hue, emblematic of a powerful champion. Purple is a popular color of choice for the attire of champions and nobles alike.

890060.name: Champion's Thread

890061.desc: Crystalline blue rock that's almost freezing to the touch.

dictionary.lore: Crystalline blue rock that's almost freezing to the touch. Said to appear in abundance around demon lairs, which is how it earned its ominous name.

890061.name: Demon Ore

899998.desc: Boosts Atk & Def by -75% & boosts HP, Rec, critical hit rate by 25%

dictionary.lore: The Omni Evolutions are just around the corner! But why not make things more interesting by facing a real challenge? Equip this Sphere and find out who is the Bravest of them all! Be a man!

899998.name: Most Bravest Blade

dictionary.lore: Feeling bored because contents are too easy for you? Be a real Brave and equip this sphere!

5008000.desc:
Adds the following effects to LS:
150% boost to Atk and 120% boost to Def, Rec, max HP when 2 or more elements are present, 10% damage reduction & raises Atk parameter limits to 180000

dictionary.lore:
Adds the following effects to LS:
150% boost to Atk and 120% boost to Def, Rec, max HP when 2 or more elements are present, 10% damage reduction & raises Atk parameter limits to 180000

5008000.name: Otherworldly Paradigm

5008001.desc: 150% boost to Atk, 100% boost to Def, Rec, max HP & adds “Final Embrace” effect to BB/SBB

dictionary.lore: 150% boost to Atk, 100% boost to Def, Rec, max HP & adds “Final Embrace” effect to BB/SBB

5008001.name: Final Embrace

88700001.desc: Damage taken may restore HP, negates all status ailments, negates critical and element based damage & 20% boost to max HP, Rec

dictionary.lore: Many legendary knights are said to have perished in their quest for this artifact. Rumor has it that only a certain few know how to truly manifest its blessings in this world. However, there may be another way to draw out its immense power--for a dark price.

88700001.name: The Grail

dictionary.lore: A weapon with a blade that has been forged from a river of infinite light. Only those who are worthy can bear its might, for the weak-hearted will be plunged into eternal darkness.

88700003.desc: 30% boost to Atk, max HP, boosts BB Atk when Sparks have exceeded certain amount & boosts Spark damage when HP is full

dictionary.lore: A replica of Excalibur, a legendary photon sword sought by many. It was discovered and enhanced by a vengeful renegade knight during his years of wandering.

88700003.name: Caliburn

88700004.desc: 30% boost to max HP, boosts Atk relative to how high remaining HP is, boosts BB gauge each turn & damage taken boosts BB gauge

dictionary.lore: An artificial arm that was enhanced further into a deadly weapon, this prosthesis was wielded by an ambitious soldier. No one knows what happened after its master's last battle.

88700004.name: Arondight

88700005.desc: Fragments of elemental power crystallized into a brittle physical form.

dictionary.lore: Fragments of elemental power crystallized into a brittle physical form. They are often sought for their power in crafting magical items, although some sorcerer-engineers prefer more reliably consistent materials.

88700005.name: Fragment

88700006.desc: A robot of many shapes and sizes that can be found almost anywhere in NeoAvalon.

dictionary.lore: A robot of many shapes and sizes that can be found almost anywhere in NeoAvalon. Not only can it can perform a wide variety of tasks, but it is also highly sought after for its ability to bend light in crafting weapons and armor for knights.

88700006.name: Photon Bot

88700007.desc: 35% boost to all parameters, reduces BB gauge required for BB, damage taken slightly boosts BB gauge, negates all status ailments and Atk, Def, Rec reductions & 5% damage reduction from Dark, Light, Fire types
88700007.name: Photon Scepter

88700008.desc: 30% boost to Atk, max HP, hugely boosts Spark damage for 2 turns when Sparks have exceeded certain amount, 100% boost to Spark damage & Spark damage boosts BB gauge
88700008.name: Cursed Photon Rod

88700009.desc: 100% boost to Atk, Rec and 30% boost to critical hit rate when BB gauge is full, boosts Thunder elemental damage, enormously boosts OD gauge fill rate for 2 turns when HC collected has exceeded certain amount & adds Def ignoring effect to attack

dictionary.lore: A powerful lance customized by the cyber masters of Avalon which can be used to summon the staggering strength of a cavalry charge.

88700009.name: Photon Spear
